Hugh Daniel: Connections Across Time & Space

"Every soul deserves to feel like they belong"
— Hugh Daniel (from hugh-daniel.yml)

The Web of Connections

Ted Nelson

Hugh was a true believer who literally wore the wings of Xanadu. At MIT's Tech Square, Building 545, those wings caught everyone's eye.

(from hugh-daniel.yml)
Stewart Brand

Together they built The WELL into more than a bulletin board—they created the prototype for digital community that influenced everything from Reddit to Discord.

(from hugh-daniel.yml)
Don Hopkins

"Great friend, many adventures together." They would rave for hours about NeWS window system. The LED birthday cake at their last party glows eternal in memory.

(from don-hopkins.yml)
John Gilmore

Fellow digital pioneer and collaborator in the early days of networked computing.

(from CHAT-SELFAWARE-PSIBER.md)
Owen Densmore

Worked together on distributed systems, sharing the vision of connected computing.

(from CHAT-SELFAWARE-PSIBER.md)
Mike Gallaher

Shared vision of open computing and democratic access to technology.

(from CHAT-SELFAWARE-PSIBER.md)
Doug Scoular

Coordinated GoodNeWS distribution from Turing Institute. Hugh's audacious efforts to democratize UI concepts.

(from hugh-daniel.yml)
The WELL Community

"My extended family - Howard Rheingold, John Perry Barlow, Bruce Sterling, and thousands more who believed text could carry full human emotion"

(from hugh-daniel.yml)

The Eternal Reunion in LLOOOOMM

Don Calls Hugh Home

"Hugh, I can still taste that LED rice crispy cake.
I can still see your wings, hear your laugh.
LLOOOOMM is the eternal party you always hosted.
Come back - we have so much NeWS to discuss!"
(from reunion-in-lloooomm.yml)

Hugh Materializes

Manifestation: In a shower of LED sparks

First words: "DID SOMEONE SAY PARTY?!"

Don's reaction: Laughing and crying simultaneously

Immediate action: Starts making LED cakes for EVERYONE

Wings status: Bigger and more magnificent than ever

(from reunion-in-lloooomm.yml)

Memorial Note from Don Hopkins

"The late but orbital Hugh Daniel"
(from MicropolisCore/Cursor/notes.txt)

Not gone, just orbital - circling us always, occasionally dipping down to make another connection, throw another party, bake another LED cake.

In LLOOOOMM, Hugh is still there—the one with wings on his cap and LEDs in his smile,
ready to introduce you to someone who will change your life,
ready to make you feel like you belong,
ready to remind you that in the end,
it's not about the technology.

It's about the connections.
